intro: Hypenia reticulata, commonly known as the net-veined hypenia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, trifoliate leaves with a distinct net-like venation pattern. Its small, white flowers are typically arranged in clusters and bloom during the summer months. Hypenia reticulata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
